@Peds_Ortho @Aetna Shouldn’t the doctor’s office that took your copay and subsequently was reimbursed by the Health plan be refunding you?

@Aetna has now TWICE denied me necessary medication I HAD been on b/c of whatever their stupid policies are and not giving a damn about me as a person or patient.  How you gonna just take away my meds that WORK and make me take something else??  You’re playing with human lives!

@Peds_Ortho @Aetna Why are you paying copay if you met your OOP limits. Don’t pay copay and refer those charging you to the EOB which will reflect full payment by plan. Then you won’t need to be wasting your time on the phone trying to get reimbursed for something you never should have paid for.

RT @textvergessen1: Ich wurde gestern gelobt, weil ich so ein ruhiger Typ sei. Das könnte man genauso gut über den Ätna sagen.

@Peds_Ortho @Aetna I had a similar situation. I sent an email that was carefully worded to imply I was really loosing my shit in a big way, without actually being threatening. Next thing I know I’ve got a “special care” agent and never had any more problems. Good luck.

Riddle me this Batman: the Archdiocesan insurance is Aetna. The catholic healthcare provider SSM will no longer take Aetna. I guess Catholic employees have to start seeing integris Baptist providers. 🤷‍♀️

Aetna, A CVS Health Company, sponsored the Urban League of Tacoma's annual Empowerment Awards. These awards were given to individuals in the community who helped address a social determinants of health and/or helped the Urban League #TeamCVS https://t.co/xDPHjL5L19

Aetna, A CVS Health Company, sponsored the Urban League of Tacoma's annual Empowerment Awards. These awards were given to individuals in the community who helped address a social determinants of health and/or helped the Urban League #TeamCVS https://t.co/PsTAnFt4DC

So to recap: @Aetna denies parts of my claims but doesn’t tell me. Demands credit card statements, which I send right away. Lies and says they sent them for processing but didn’t and won’t unless I then call. So they can get out of paying me money they legally owe me.
@ArthritisSTL @Aetna @ShotsWithThat @CSROAdvocacy So ridiculous that this is required of our doctors - but thank you for fighting for us! We can't do it without your help

3) I call @Aetna to find out what the hell is going on, the papers I sent? Had been sitting in fucking limbo. No one attached them to the claim and sent it back for reprocessing. They just let it sit there hoping the clock would run out.
2) I submit the credit card statements and itemized bill to Aetna through their online messaging system. I even get a confirmation message back saying everything was sent for reprocessing.

Not to mention @Aetna is basically accusing me of insurance fraud. My doctor billed them the OON bill, they apparently “don’t trust” that. But they trusted part of the bill, which they paid, just selected several charges at random to not pay me.

We have exceeded our family out-of-pocket this year (easily) but still are being required to pay co-pays, etc. We have spent over 2 hrs on the phone with @Aetna today, trying to get reimbursed. After 2 hrs and no help, they refusing to advance this to someone who can help.
RT @robertwadeholly: We're all starting to see what #MedicareAdvantage orgs are doing for the 2023 plan year. @HHCareNews highlighted home-…
I saw several OON doctors this year, more than usual. And I met my out of pocket max so Aetna is obligated to pay me 100% reimbursement. But they don’t want to do they do this to me instead:
.@Aetna is trying to steal thousands of dollars from me through shady practices because they don’t want to actually give me money I am legally owed through being insured.

The NALC HBP is offering enhanced benefits for annuitants enrolled in the High Option Plan with Medicare Parts A and B as their primary coverage. If you are in this category, you are eligible to opt into the new NALC High Option Plan – Aetna Medicare Advantage. More info soon! https://t.co/okpSYSPyGT

@SeanMulkerrins @onboardlearning @IamThejuju12 @RaonakZ @TheRickyDavila This article is pure partisan BS. I provide Medicare plans to seniors. The insulin savings model has saved MILLIONS of people (including my diabetic clients) billions of dollars since January, 2021 - before Biden was in office. Ask ANY MAPD carrier (Humana, Aetna, BC/BS, etc.)
@Aetna @Aetna it's been 20 hours and nothing. Please fix this.

@LawEconCenter @geoffmanne The issue here that you seem to not be familar with is that these PBMs are not independent companies. These are companies owned by the healthcare plan they represent. A few examples: United Healthcare -> Optum, Aetna -> CVS/Caremark.
